name: Ensure strict mode is enabled when creating session (PHP)
description: This rule checks all the calls to session_start() without using strict mode.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: By crafting a malicious link, an attacker can set a session token of his knowledge into the browser of a victim. When the victim authenticates himself over the web application, the attacker is in the possession of a valid token and can hijack the session of the victim.
reference:
CWE-384: Session Fixation
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/384.html

OWASP Top Ten 2021 Category A07:2021 - Identification and Authentication Failures
https://owasp.org/Top10/A07_2021-Identification_and_Authentication_Failures/

PHP: Runtime Configuration - Manual
https://www.php.net/manual/en/session.configuration.php#ini.session.use-strict-mode
remediation:
Set session.use_strict_mode to 'On' in configuration file.

Alternatively, set it with ini_set('session.use_strict_mode', 'On').
sample:
# In source code:

session_start();

# AND in configuration file

session.use_strict_mode="Off"
alternativeName: Avoid disabling option session.use_strict_mode in configuration file
